sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Remembering those dreadful memories, Will suddenly opens his eyes.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: He tries to catch his breath.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: His face is pale and his body is trembling. He’s been laying around for a while now. Yet, his body is tired.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Will is wet and freezing, but he still didn’t want to go back to that empty apartment.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: His state of mind is a mess. His body is weak. He doesn’t know where to go or what to do.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: I hate this, I just hate everything. . .

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Will suddenly feels a sharp pain in his head, and then he throws up

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: I don’t want to go home.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: His head is empty. His eyes are cloudy. He stands up and without knowing his legs start moving by themself.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: His mind forgets but his body remembers.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: His mind denies the pain yet his body seeks for comfort.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Without knowing, he starts walking to the only other place that he used to call home.
